io.netty.handler.codec.sctp

Class SctpMessageCompletionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelStateHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundMessageHandlerAdapter<SctpMessage>
          • io.netty.handler.codec.sctp.SctpMessageCompletionHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelHandlerUtil.SingleInboundMessageHandler<SctpMessage>, ChannelInboundMessageHandler<SctpMessage>, ChannelStateHandler

    public class SctpMessageCompletionHandler
extends ChannelInboundMessageHandlerAdapter<SctpMessage>
    ChannelInboundMessageHandlerAdapter which will take care of handle fragmented SctpMessages, so only complete SctpMessages will be forwarded to the next ChannelInboundMessageHandler.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

    • Method Detail

      • beginMessageReceived

        public boolean beginMessageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                             throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelHandlerUtil.SingleInboundMessageHandler
        Will get notified once ChannelStateHandler.inboundBufferUpdated(ChannelHandlerContext) was called. If this method returns false no further processing of the MessageBuf will be done until the next call of ChannelStateHandler.inboundBufferUpdated(ChannelHandlerContext). This will return true by default, and may get overriden by sub-classes for special handling.
        Specified by:
        beginMessageReceived in interface ChannelHandlerUtil.SingleInboundMessageHandler<SctpMessage>
        Overrides:
        beginMessageReceived in class ChannelInboundMessageHandlerAdapter<SctpMessage>
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this ChannelHandler belongs to
        Throws:
        Exception
